results.title: Doctor Dolittle
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Arthur P. Jacobs and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
This is a charming fantasy excursion which creates a wonderful world of endless imagination through music, dance and special effects. Rex Harrison stars in the madcap adventures of a 19th century English doctor who walks and talks and squawks with the animals. Based on the stories of Hugh Lofting, the good doctor gets himself into all sorts of funny predicaments in this fun film that earned an Academy Award nomination for Best Picture. With terrific music, fine acting, lovable creatures and a joyous fantasy tale, “Doctor Doolittle” is a classic for young and old alike.
Cast also includes: Samantha Eggar, Anthony Newley, Peter Bull and Richard Attenborough.

results.title: Pollyanna
results.brief_description: Adapted from the popular story by Eleanor Parker. Pollyanna (Hayley Mills) glows as the little orphan girl who believes that “things are always better than they seem”. She manages to change the heart of an entire town including her Aunt Polly (Jane Wyman). Judged by the public and critics alike as one of Walt Disney’s finest achievements. Pollyanna is a celebration of life. Rated G.

results.title: Silver City
results.brief_description: While travelling by train to Sydney, Nina, a teacher of Polish extraction meets a fellow Pole, Julian, whom she has not seen for many years. They recall their time at “Silver City” the camp for new Australians where they met in 1949. She was drawn to Julian from the start, it did not matter to her that he was married with a child, and they began an affair. Unable to become a teacher at this time due to her lack of qualifications, Nina takes on a job as a domestic in a country hospital. She is then transferred to a camp near Sydney where she again meets up with Julian. Together they are befriended by two Australians and begin to experience the positive side of their new lives in Australia. But when Julian returns to his wife, Nina is devastated. By 1962 she has fulfilled her desire to become a teacher, yet she remains alone.

results.title: The Two Gentlemen of Verona
results.creator_credit: Don Taylor, Shaun Sutton and BBC
results.brief_description: Porteous betrays his love, Julia, and deceives his close friend Valentine when the two become rivals for the affections of Silvia, who flees to the forest in protest. Valentine becomes an outlaw pursued by Proteous and his page (Julia in disguise). Valentine eventually forgives his treacherous friend and marries Silvia while Proteous marries Julia.

results.title: The Gay divorcee
results.creator_credit: Mark Sandrich and Pandro S. Berman
results.brief_description: Adapted from the 1932 Cole Porter musical. The plot of “The Gay Divorcee”, rooted in mistaken identity is delightful. The script is sophisticated and bright and the cast is impeccable for comedy of this nature. Comparable to the best of Busby Berkeley and the most ingenious ballets of Gene Kelly, The Continental” dance routine is sufficient to turn “The Gay Divorcee into one of your most thrilling musical experiences. Stars Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers.

results.title: Anchors aweigh
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Joe Pasternak and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: There are many moments of stunning virtuosity in George Sidney’s exuberant musical entertainment “Anchors Aweigh”. One of the most wonderful of all MGM’s musicals, it is set in Los Angeles and Hollywood. Isobel Lennart’s witty screenplay is about two sailors on leave - Gene Kelly and Frank Sinatra - and their involvement with a Hollywood extra - Kathryn Grayson - whom they want to help become a musical star. The songs include “All of a Sudden my Heart Sings”, “Jealousy”, “All of a Sudden my Heart Sings”, “I Fall in Love too Easily” and “What Makes the Sunset”. Rated: G

results.title: Waterloo bridge
results.creator_credit: Mervyn LeRoy, Sidney A. Franklin and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Starring Vivian Leigh and Robert Taylor, this is a tragic tale. An army officer marries a ballerina. When he is reported missing his family ignores her and she sinks into prostitution. A ‘weepie’ which has had mixed reviews over time, but still remains very popular.

results.title: Suddenly last summer
results.creator_credit: Joseph L Mankiewicz, Sam Spiegel and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: From a Tennessee Williams play, an outrageous, melodramatic piece touching on madness, homosexual prostitution, incest, disease and cannibalism. Stars Elizabeth Taylor, Katherine Hepburn, Montgomery Clift. Adapted for the screen by Gore Vidal.

results.title: Sylvia Scarlett
results.creator_credit: George Cukor, Pandro S. Berman and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Directed by legendary film maker George Cukor, the dazzling talents of Katharine Hepburn and Cary Grant light up the screen in this engaging lovingly filmed comedy adventure. When her father runs afoul of the law in re-war Paris, a plucky young girl (Katharine Hepburn) disguises herself as a boy to aid in their escape. But when they team up with a low-brow con-man (Cary Grant), Kate’s scheming soon precipitates a disastrous series of uproarious romantic misunderstandings.

results.title: Henry V
results.creator_credit: David Giles, Cedric Messina and BBC
results.brief_description: Shortly after his coronation, Henry V decided to press his claims to the French throne and leads an army into France. He defeats a vastly larger French army at Agincourt (1415), wins the hand of the French Princess Catherine of Valois, and is recognised as the heir to the French throne.
